reference.text: for chemical matters, see subclass A23C

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Devices or accessories for milking by hand
Control or regulation of milking machines

CPC-specific-text.text: with a specially adapted stimulation of the teats

reference.text: air or gas separators in combination with liquid meters G01F15/08

title-part.text: On-site detection of mastitis in milk

CPC-specific-text.text: by analysing the milk composition, e.g. concentration or detection of specific substances
by using electricity, e.g. conductivity or capacitance
by using light, e.g. light absorption or light transmission
by using milk flow characteristics, e.g. differences between udder quarters or differences with previous milking runs
by using sound, e.g. ultrasonic detection

title-part.text: Automatic attaching or detaching of clusters

CPC-specific-text.text: Milk lines or coupling devices for milk conduits
Vacuum generating means, e.g. by connecting to the air-inlet of a tractor engine

title-part.text: Pulsators arranged otherwise than on teat-cups
Accessories for milking machines or devices

CPC-specific-text.text: Automatic vacuum shutoff at the end of milking

title-part.text: for cleaning or sanitising milking machines or devices

CPC-specific-text.text: Clean-in-Place Systems, i.e. CIP, for cleaning the complete milking installation in place
Teat cup cleaning, e.g. by rinse jetters or nozzles
Vessel cleaning, e.g. cleansing of milk tanks, milk vessels or milk separators

title-part.text: for treatment of udders or teats, e.g. for cleaning
Holding or supporting devices for milking receptacles
Milking pails connected with milking stools

reference.text: dairy concentration, evaporation or drying A23C1/00; preservation of milk or milk preparations A23C3/00

title-part.text: Appliances for preventing or destroying foam

reference.text: preventing boiling-over of milk in kitchen cooking vessels A47J27/56

title-part.text: Appliances for aerating or de-aerating milk
Holders for strainers or cloth filters
by raising the level of the milk
with beating equipment which is movable in respect of the churn wall
without beating equipment which is movable in respect of the churn wall
Devices for manufacturing butter other than by churns
with arrangements for making butter in a continuous process
Churns with arrangements for making butter by blowing-in air
Lids or covers for butter churns
Means for removing butter from churns or the like
Combined appliances for separating, churning and kneading
Kneading or forming margarine or butter substitutes
Kneading machines for butter, or the like
Hand devices for forming slabs of butter, or the like
Machines for forming slabs of butter, or the like
with extruding arrangements and cutting devices, with or without packing devices
Devices for dividing bulk butter, or the like

CPC-specific-text.text: by filling curd into permanent containers, i.e. for sale of the final product
Apparatus for making soft unripened cheese, e.g. cottage or cream cheese
Apparatus for making soft uncured Italian cheese, e.g. Mozzarella, Ricotta, Pasta Filata cheese

title-part.text: Devices for removing cheese from basins
Devices for removing whey from basins
Devices for treating cheese during ripening

CPC-specific-text.text: for storing or turning of cheese
Cold-storage rooms or ventilation systems for stocked cheese

title-part.text: Coating the cheese, e.g. with paraffin wax
Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass
